param.name: api_sig
param.doc: The api signature.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of recent activity on photos commented on by the calling user. Do not poll this method more than once an hour.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of items to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 10. The maximum allowed value is 50.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of recent activity on photos belonging to the calling user. Do not poll this method more than once an hour.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

param.name: timeframe
param.doc: The timeframe in which to return updates for. This can be specified in days ('2d') or hours ('4h'). The default behavoir is to return changes since the beginning of the previous user session.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of items to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 10. The maximum allowed value is 50.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get a list of configured blogs for the calling user.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: blog_id
param.doc: The id of the blog to post to

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to blog

param.name: title
param.doc: The blog post title

param.name: description
param.doc: The blog post body

param.name: blog_password
param.doc: The password for the blog (used when the blog does not have a stored password).

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get a list of contacts for the calling user.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: filter
param.doc:
An optional filter of the results. The following values are valid:
 
friends
Only contacts who are friends (and not family)
family
Only contacts who are family (and not friends)
both
Only contacts who are both friends and family
neither
Only contacts who are neither friends nor family

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1000. The maximum allowed value is 1000.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get the contact list for a user.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: user_id
param.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch the contact list for.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1000. The maximum allowed value is 1000.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a photo to a user's favorites list.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to add to the user's favorites.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of the user's favorite photos. Only photos which the calling user has permission to see are returned.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: user_id
param.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch the favorites list for. If this argument is omitted, the favorites list for the calling user is returned.

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of favorite public photos for the given user.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: user_id
param.doc: The user to fetch the favorites list for.

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: auth_token

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to remove from the user's favorites.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Browse the group category tree, finding groups and sub-categories.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: cat_id
param.doc: The category id to fetch a list of groups and sub-categories for. If not specified, it defaults to zero, the root of the category tree.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get information about a group.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: group_id
param.doc: The NSID of the group to fetch information for.

param.name: lang
param.doc: The language of the group name and description to fetch. If the language is not found, the primary language of the group will be returned. Valid values are the same as in feeds.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Search for groups. 18+ groups will only be returned for authenticated calls where the authenticated user is over 18.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: text
param.doc: The text to search for.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of groups to return per page. If this argument is ommited, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is ommited, it defaults to 1.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Add a photo to a group's pool.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to add to the group pool. The photo must belong to the calling user.

param.name: group_id
param.doc: The NSID of the group who's pool the photo is to be added to.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns next and previous photos for a photo in a group pool.

param.name: photo_id

param.name: group_id
param.doc: The nsid of the group who's pool to fetch the photo's context for.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of groups to which you can add photos.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of groups to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 400. The maximum allowed value is 400.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of pool photos for a given group, based on the permissions of the group and the user logged in (if any).

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: group_id
param.doc: The id of the group who's pool you which to get the photo list for.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A tag to filter the pool with. At the moment only one tag at a time is supported.

param.name: user_id
param.doc: The nsid of a user. Specifiying this parameter will retrieve for you only those photos that the user has contributed to the group pool.

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Remove a photo from a group pool.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to remove from the group pool. The photo must either be owned by the calling user of the calling user must be an administrator of the group.

param.name: group_id
param.doc: The NSID of the group who's pool the photo is to removed from.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

param.name: safe_search
param.doc:
Safe search setting:
  • 1 for safe.
  • 2 for moderate.
  • 3 for restricted.
(Please note: Un-authed calls can only see Safe content.)

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims.

param.doc: The photo to return information for.

param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Fetch a list of recent photos from the calling users' contacts.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: count
param.doc: Number of photos to return. Defaults to 10, maximum 50. This is only used if single_photo is not passed.

param.name: just_friends
param.doc: set as 1 to only show photos from friends and family (excluding regular contacts).

param.name: single_photo
param.doc: Only fetch one photo (the latest) per contact, instead of all photos in chronological order.

param.name: include_self
param.doc: Set to 1 to include photos from the calling user.

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Fetch a list of recent public photos from a users' contacts.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: user_id
param.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch photos for.

param.name: count
param.doc: Number of photos to return. Defaults to 10, maximum 50. This is only used if single_photo is not passed.

param.name: just_friends
param.doc: set as 1 to only show photos from friends and family (excluding regular contacts).

param.name: single_photo
param.doc: Only fetch one photo (the latest) per contact, instead of all photos in chronological order.

param.name: include_self
param.doc: Set to 1 to include photos from the user specified by user_id.

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns next and previous photos for a photo in a photostream.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to fetch the context for.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gets a list of photo counts for the given date ranges for the calling user.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: dates
param.doc: A comma delimited list of unix timestamps, denoting the periods to return counts for. They should be specified smallest first.

param.name: taken_dates
param.doc: A comma delimited list of mysql datetimes, denoting the periods to return counts for. They should be specified smallest first.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Retrieves a list of EXIF/TIFF/GPS tags for a given photo. The calling user must have permission to view the photo.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to fetch information for.

param.name: secret
param.doc: The secret for the photo. If the correct secret is passed then permissions checking is skipped. This enables the 'sharing' of individual photos by passing around the id and secret.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the list of people who have favorited a given photo.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The ID of the photo to fetch the favoriters list for.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of usres to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 10. The maximum allowed value is 50.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get information about a photo. The calling user must have permission to view the photo.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to get information for.

param.name: secret
param.doc: The secret for the photo. If the correct secret is passed then permissions checking is skipped. This enables the 'sharing' of individual photos by passing around the id and secret.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of your photos that are not part of any sets.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: min_upload_date
param.doc: Minimum upload date. Photos with an upload date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: max_upload_date
param.doc: Maximum upload date. Photos with an upload date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: min_taken_date
param.doc: Minimum taken date. Photos with an taken date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

param.name: max_taken_date
param.doc: Maximum taken date. Photos with an taken date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

param.name: privacy_filter
param.doc:
Return photos only matching a certain privacy level. Valid values are:
  • 1 public photos
  • 2 private photos visible to friends
  • 3 private photos visible to family
  • 4 private photos visible to friends & family
  • 5 completely private photos

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.doc: Get permissions for a photo.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: auth_token

Return photos only matching a certain privacy level. Valid values are:
  • 1 public photos
  • 2 private photos visible to friends

  • 4 private photos visible to friends & family

param.name: sort
param.doc: The order in which to sort returned photos. Deafults to date-posted-desc. The possible values are: date-posted-asc, date-posted-desc, date-taken-asc, date-taken-desc, interestingness-desc, and interestingness-asc.

Return photos only matching a certain privacy level. Valid values are:
  • 1 public photos
  • 2 private photos visible to friends
  • 3 private photos visible to family
  • 4 private photos visible to friends & family
  • 5 completely private photos

param.name: sort
param.doc: The order in which to sort returned photos. Deafults to date-posted-desc. The possible values are: date-posted-asc, date-posted-desc, date-taken-asc, date-taken-desc, interestingness-desc, and interestingness-asc.

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Return a list of your photos that have been recently created or which have been recently modified.

Recently modified may mean that the photo's metadata (title, description, tags) may have been changed or a comment has been added (or just modified somehow :-)

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: min_date
param.doc: A Unix timestamp indicating the date from which modifications should be compared.

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Remove a tag from a photo.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: tag_id
param.doc: The tag to remove from the photo. This parameter should contain a tag id, as returned by flickr.photos.getInfo.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Return a list of photos matching some criteria. Only photos visible to the calling user will be returned. To return private or semi-private photos, the caller must be authenticated with 'read' permissions, and have permission to view the photos. Unauthenticated calls will only return public photos.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: user_id
param.doc: The NSID of the user who's photo to search. If this parameter isn't passed then everybody's public photos will be searched. A value of "me" will search against the calling user's photos for authenticated calls.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of tags. Photos with one or more of the tags listed will be returned.

param.name: tag_mode
param.doc: Either 'any' for an OR combination of tags, or 'all' for an AND combination. Defaults to 'any' if not specified.

param.name: text
param.doc: A free text search. Photos who's title, description or tags contain the text will be returned.

param.name: min_upload_date
param.doc: Minimum upload date. Photos with an upload date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: max_upload_date
param.doc: Maximum upload date. Photos with an upload date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

param.name: min_taken_date
param.doc: Minimum taken date. Photos with an taken date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

param.name: max_taken_date
param.doc: Maximum taken date. Photos with an taken date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

param.name: license
param.doc: The license id for photos (for possible values see the flickr.photos.licenses.getInfo method). Multiple licenses may be comma-separated.

param.name: sort
param.doc: The order in which to sort returned photos. Deafults to date-posted-desc. The possible values are: date-posted-asc, date-posted-desc, date-taken-asc, date-taken-desc, interestingness-desc, interestingness-asc, and relevance.

param.name: privacy_filter
param.doc:
Return photos only matching a certain privacy level. This only applies when making an authenticated call to view photos you own. Valid values are:
  • 1 public photos
  • 2 private photos visible to friends
  • 3 private photos visible to family
  • 4 private photos visible to friends & family
  • 5 completely private photos

param.name: bbox
param.doc:
A comma-delimited list of 4 values defining the Bounding Box of the area that will be searched.

The 4 values represent the bottom-left corner of the box and the top-right corner, minimum_longitude, minimum_latitude, maximum_longitude, maximum_latitude.

Longitude has a range of -180 to 180 , latitude of -90 to 90. Defaults to -180, -90, 180, 90 if not specified.

Unlike standard photo queries, geo (or bounding box) queries will only return 250 results per page.

Geo queries require some sort of limiting agent in order to prevent the database from crying. This is basically like the check against "parameterless searches" for queries without a geo component.

A tag, for instance, is considered a limiting agent as are user defined min_date_taken and min_date_upload parameters — If no limiting factor is passed we return only photos added in the last 12 hours (though we may extend the limit in the future).

param.name: accuracy
param.doc:
Recorded accuracy level of the location information. Current range is 1-16 :
  • World level is 1
  • Country is ~3
  • Region is ~6
  • City is ~11
  • Street is ~16
Defaults to maximum value if not specified.

param.name: safe_search
param.doc:
Safe search setting:
  • 1 for safe.
  • 2 for moderate.
  • 3 for restricted.
(Please note: Un-authed calls can only see Safe content.)

param.name: content_type
param.doc:
Content Type setting:
  • 1 for photos only.
  • 2 for screenshots only.
  • 3 for 'other' only.
  • 4 for photos and screenshots.
  • 5 for screenshots and 'other'.
  • 6 for photos and 'other'.
  • 7 for photos, screenshots, and 'other' (all).

param.name: machine_tags
param.doc:
Aside from passing in a fully formed machine tag, there is a special syntax for searching on specific properties :
  • Find photos using the 'dc' namespace : "machine_tags" => "dc:"
  • Find photos with a title in the 'dc' namespace : "machine_tags" => "dc:title="
  • Find photos titled "mr. camera" in the 'dc' namespace : "machine_tags" => "dc:title=\"mr. camera\"
  • Find photos whose value is "mr. camera" : "machine_tags" => "*:*=\"mr. camera\""
  • Find photos that have a title, in any namespace : "machine_tags" => "*:title="
  • Find photos that have a title, in any namespace, whose value is "mr. camera" : "machine_tags" => "*:title=\"mr. camera\""
  • Find photos, in the 'dc' namespace whose value is "mr. camera" : "machine_tags" => "dc:*=\"mr. camera\""
Multiple machine tags may be queried by passing a comma-separated list. The number of machine tags you can pass in a single query depends on the tag mode (AND or OR) that you are querying with. "AND" queries are limited to (16) machine tags. "OR" queries are limited to (8).

param.name: machine_tag_mode
param.doc: Either 'any' for an OR combination of tags, or 'all' for an AND combination. Defaults to 'any' if not specified.

param.name: group_id
param.doc: The id of a group who's pool to search. If specified, only matching photos posted to the group's pool will be returned.

param.name: place_id
param.doc:
A Flickr place id. (only used if bbox argument isn't present). Experimental.

Geo queries require some sort of limiting agent in order to prevent the database from crying. This is basically like the check against "parameterless searches" for queries without a geo component.

A tag, for instance, is considered a limiting agent as are user defined min_date_taken and min_date_upload parameters &emdash; If no limiting factor is passed we return only photos added in the last 12 hours (though we may extend the limit in the future).

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims.

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: POST

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to set the adultness of.

param.name: content_type
param.doc: The content type of the photo. Must be one of: 1 for Photo, 2 for Screenshot, and 3 for Other.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

param.name: date_posted
param.doc: The date the photo was uploaded to flickr (see the dates documentation)

param.name: date_taken
param.doc: The date the photo was taken (see the dates documentation)

param.name: date_taken_granularity
param.doc: The granularity of the date the photo was taken (see the dates documentation)

param.name: auth_token

param.name: description

method.name: POST
method.doc: Set permissions for a photo.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to set permissions for.

param.name: is_public
param.doc: 1 to set the photo to public, 0 to set it to private.

param.name: is_friend
param.doc: 1 to make the photo visible to friends when private, 0 to not.

param.name: is_family
param.doc: 1 to make the photo visible to family when private, 0 to not.

param.name: perm_comment
param.doc:
who can add comments to the photo and it's notes. one of:
0: nobody
1: friends & family
2: contacts
3: everybody

param.name: perm_addmeta
param.doc:
who can add notes and tags to the photo. one of:
0: nobody / just the owner
1: friends & family
2: contacts
3: everybody

method.name: POST
method.doc: Set the safety level of a photo.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to set the adultness of.

param.name: safety_level
param.doc:
The safety level of the photo. Must be one of:
1 for Safe, 2 for Moderate, and 3 for Restricted.

param.name: hidden
param.doc: Whether or not to additionally hide the photo from public searches. Must be either 1 for Yes or 0 for No.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Sets the geo data (latitude and longitude and, optionally, the accuracy level) for a photo. Before users may assign location data to a photo they must define who, by default, may view that information. Users can edit this preference at http://www.flickr.com/account/geo/privacy/. If a user has not set this preference, the API method will return an error.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to set location data for.

param.name: lat
param.doc: The latitude whose valid range is -90 to 90. Anything more than 6 decimal places will be truncated.

param.name: lon
param.doc: The longitude whose valid range is -180 to 180. Anything more than 6 decimal places will be truncated.

param.name: accuracy
param.doc: Recorded accuracy level of the location information. World level is 1, Country is ~3, Region ~6, City ~11, Street ~16. Current range is 1-16. Defaults to 16 if not specified.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Set the permission for who may view the geo data associated with a photo.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: is_public
param.doc: 1 to set viewing permissions for the photo's location data to public, 0 to set it to private.

param.name: is_contact
param.doc: 1 to set viewing permissions for the photo's location data to contacts, 0 to set it to private.

param.name: is_friend
param.doc: 1 to set viewing permissions for the photo's location data to friends, 0 to set it to private.

param.name: is_family
param.doc: 1 to set viewing permissions for the photo's location data to family, 0 to set it to private.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to get permissions for.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Modify the photos in a photoset. Use this method to add, remove and re-order photos.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photoset_id
param.doc: The id of the photoset to modify. The photoset must belong to the calling user.

param.name: primary_photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to use as the 'primary' photo for the set. This id must also be passed along in photo_ids list argument.

param.name: photo_ids
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of photo ids to include in the set. They will appear in the set in the order sent. This list must contain the primary photo id. All photos must belong to the owner of the set. This list of photos replaces the existing list. Call flickr.photosets.addPhoto to append a photo to a set.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

param.name: extras
param.doc: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update.

param.name: privacy_filter
param.doc:
Return photos only matching a certain privacy level. This only applies when making an authenticated call to view a photoset you own. Valid values are:
  • 1 public photos
  • 2 private photos visible to friends
  • 3 private photos visible to family
  • 4 private photos visible to friends & family
  • 5 completely private photos

param.name: per_page
param.doc: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 500. The maximum allowed value is 500.

param.name: page
param.doc: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

param.name: api_key

param.name: photoset_ids
param.doc: A comma delimited list of photoset IDs, ordered with the set to show first, first in the list. Any set IDs not given in the list will be set to appear at the end of the list, ordered by their IDs.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

param.name: photoset_id

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Return a list of place IDs for a query string.

The flickr.places.find method is not a geocoder. It will round up to the nearest place type to which place IDs apply. For example, if you pass it a street level address it will return the city that contains the address rather than the street, or building, itself.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: query
param.doc: The query string to use for place ID lookups

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Return a place ID for a latitude, longitude and accuracy triple.

The flickr.places.findByLatLon method is not meant to be a (reverse) geocoder in the traditional sense. It is designed to allow users to find photos for "places" and will round up to the nearest place type to which corresponding place IDs apply.

For example, if you pass it a street level coordinate it will return the city that contains the point rather than the street, or building, itself.

It will also truncate latitudes and longitudes to three decimal points.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: lat
param.doc: The latitude whose valid range is -90 to 90. Anything more than 4 decimal places will be truncated.

param.name: lon
param.doc: The longitude whose valid range is -180 to 180. Anything more than 4 decimal places will be truncated.

param.name: accuracy
param.doc: Recorded accuracy level of the location information. World level is 1, Country is ~3, Region ~6, City ~11, Street ~16. Current range is 1-16. The default is 16.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Find Flickr Places information by Place Id

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: place_id
param.doc: A Flickr Places ID

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Find Flickr Places information by Place URL.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: url
param.doc:
A Flickr Places URL.

Flickr Place URLs are of the form /country/region/city

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET

param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the default hidden preference for the user.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Returns the default privacy level preference for the user. Possible values are:
  • 1 : Public
  • 2 : Friends only
  • 3 : Family only
  • 4 : Friends and Family
  • 5 : Private

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the default safety level preference for the user.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns information for a given flickr API method.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: method_name
param.doc: The name of the method to fetch information for.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of available flickr API methods.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of hot tags for the given period.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: period
param.doc: The period for which to fetch hot tags. Valid values are day and week (defaults to day).

param.name: count
param.doc: The number of tags to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed value is 200.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get the tag list for a given photo.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: photo_id
param.doc: The id of the photo to return tags for.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get the tag list for a given user (or the currently logged in user).

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: user_id
param.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch the tag list for. If this argument is not specified, the currently logged in user (if any) is assumed.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get the popular tags for a given user (or the currently logged in user).

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: user_id
param.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch the tag list for. If this argument is not specified, the currently logged in user (if any) is assumed.

param.name: count
param.doc: Number of popular tags to return. defaults to 10 when this argument is not present.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get the raw versions of a given tag (or all tags) for the currently logged-in user.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: tag
param.doc: The tag you want to retrieve all raw versions for.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of tags 'related' to the given tag, based on clustered usage analysis.

param.name: api_key
param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.name: tag
param.doc: The tag to fetch related tags for.

param.name: auth_token
param.doc: The authentication token to check.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the url to a user's photos.

param.doc: Your API application key. See here for more details.

param.doc: The NSID of the user to fetch the url for. If omitted, the calling user is assumed.

method.name: GET

param.doc: The url to the user's profile or photos page.
